intro: Bilabrella chirensis, commonly known as the Chiribiquete bilabrella, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
